claim: Exactly one post authored by an elder user has a score greater than 19.
extra_info: elder users refers to Age > 65; Score of over 19 refers to Score > = 20
reasoning: The query finds exactly one post authored by an elder user (Age > 65) with a score >= 20: Post 9017 (Score=20) by User 3382 (Age=76). This matches the claim that exactly one post authored by an elder user has a score greater than 19.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The schema has `Age` in `users` and `Score` in `posts`, with `OwnerUserId` linking posts to users. Now let me query for posts by elder users (Age > 65) with Score >= 20.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM posts p JOIN users u ON p.OwnerUserId = u.Id WHERE u.Age > 65 AND p.Score >= 20;"
input.description: Count posts by elder users with score >= 20

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT p.Id, p.Score, u.Id, u.Age FROM posts p JOIN users u ON p.OwnerUserId = u.Id WHERE u.Age > 65 AND p.Score >= 20;"

content.text:
The query confirms:
- There is **exactly 1 post** authored by an elder user (Age > 65) with a Score >= 20.
- Specifically: Post ID 9017 with Score 20, authored by User ID 3382 who is age 76.

This matches the claim exactly.
